data.title: Project Engineer III, Natural Gas
data.meta_description: Kansas City Project Engineer III, Natural Gas - MO, 64129
data.text:
At Spire, we believe energy exists to help people. To enrich their lives, grow their businesses, advance their communities. It’s a simple idea, but one that’s at the heart of everything we do. We are committed to understanding the needs of the homes and businesses we serve. That's why we're always looking for driven, collaborative people to join our team. Because we believe that offering our customers the best service means bringing together the best people.

And we find the best by hiring those who share our values of drive, safety, inclusion and integrity, and demonstrate our four essential behaviors that bring the Spire vision, mission and culture to life:

We make it happen: We are a company of go-getters, acting on every opportunity to help our company advance

We collaborate: We put teamwork first, bringing in everyone’s ideas, because our collective energy makes us stronger

We seek out perspective: We challenge ourselves to be open to different ways of doing things, because learning from each other leads to breakthroughs

We care: We treat people how we want to be treated, listening closely and doing what’s right, even when it’s hard

By living our values and behaviors every day, we strive to create an environment where every employee feels welcome, respected and valued.

Process & Gas Operations Facilities

• Performs engineering analysis and developing metering & regulating designs for large-load end customers, transmission pipelines, LNG & storage.

• Performs design metering and regulating facilities for large industrial and commercial customers and maintains a productive relationship with Marketing representatives.

• Provides engineering assistance if required for district regulator installation and for design/maintenance of SCADA systems, process controls, facilities automation, remote communication technology, etc. Implements designs complying with national/local code requirements.

• Assisting with developing of project cost estimates through design, simulation, PFDs, equipment type specification and initial sizing, P&ID development, and labor for RNG, LNG storage and pressure regulation engineering projects.

• Manages specific capital and maintenance projects including financial planning, scheduling, equipment specification and procurement, contractor interfacing, development of construction and operating drawings and project documentation.

• Support the commissioning of newly metering and regulation facilities when required.

Pipelines

• Performs engineering design for HDD bores, hydrotesting, route selection, material & equipment selection, and cost studies.

• Assists with defining the scope, schedule and budget for the design and installation of large distribution and transmission pipeline projects.

• Receives and reviews the design deliverables by a third-party engineering firm against the project budget and schedule.

• Collaborates with internal and external ROW, environmental, and regulatory agents to support survey, geotechnical investigations, permitting, and land acquisition.

• Provide engineering support during construction activities when required.

• Support the commissioning of newly installed pipeline facilities when required.

General

• Ensures effective utilization of the Company’s Geographical Information System (GIS) and asset management system to manage all capital construction design work

• Ensures the use of the Company’s standards and applicable State and Federal codes and regulations for all design work

• Ensures that all work is performed in a safe, compliant, and cost-effective manner to maximize system integrity, reliability, and value to customers

• Assists special projects as required.

• All other duties as assigned.

• We accept online applications through our career site at jobs.spireenergy.com

Disclaimer: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of the level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Spire Inc., and its subsidiaries are an Affirmative Action and Equal Employment Opportunity employer.
